item.name: List available hostnames for a new configuration

query.description: Integer	1	The index of the result page. If the value is -1, then pagination is ignored. The default value is 1.
Integer	10	The number of items on each result page. The default value is 25.
Boolean	false	When true, the results contain detailed information on versions. When false, the results contain summary information on versions.

item.name: Get the hostname coverage match targets

query.description: notMatched	Boolean	false	If true, returns all security policies in the configuration version which don't have a match target. If false, returns all security policies in the configuration version.
detail	Boolean	true	When enabled, the response features a richer set of data than the default, which includes only the name and ID of each item.

item.name: Clone or create a security policy

query.description: notMatched	Boolean	false	If true, returns all security policies in the configuration version which don't have a match target. If false, returns all security policies in the configuration version.
detail	Boolean	true	When enabled, the response features a richer set of data than the default, which includes only the name and ID of each item.

body.raw:
{
    "applyApiConstraints": true/false,
    "applyApplicationLayerControls": true/false,
    "applyNetworkLayerControls": true/false,
    "applyRateControls": true/false,
    "applySlowPostControls": true/false,
    "applyReputationControls": true/false
}

query.description: includeElements	Boolean	true	If enabled, the response list includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and yield large response objects. The default false value when listing more than one network list omits the network lists elements and only provides higher-level metadata.

extended	Boolean	true	When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network lists deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. This data takes longer to provide.
search	String	192.168.	Only list items that match the specified substring in any network lists name or list of items.

includeElements	Boolean	true	If enabled, the response list includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and yield large response objects. The default true value includes the lists contents.

extended	Boolean	true	When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network lists deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. This data takes longer to provide.

includeElements	Boolean	true	If enabled, the response list includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and yield large response objects. The default true value includes the lists contents.

extended	Boolean	true	When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network lists deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. This data takes longer to provide.

item.name: Append elements to a network list

query.description: Adds the specified element to the list. If the network lists type is IP, the value needs to be a URL-encoded IP address or CIDR block. If the type is GEO, its a two-character country code
Removes the specified element to the list. If the network lists type is IP, the value needs to be a URL-encoded IP address or CIDR block. If the type is GEO, its a two-character country code

extended	Boolean	true	When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network lists deployment status in both STAGING and PRODUCTION environments. This data takes longer to provide.
